page.title: 15CHURCHES
page.content: The ancient church of St Michael towers over the village and the bells cast closeby are rung every week.There are 160 on the Roll and on festivals it is filled with some 300 people. Prayer Book services prevail but the ASB is popular. The Methodist Church is shortly moving to a new building combining church and youth centre. Both churches have groups for study, women and young people. The churches share regular services, particularly for national and local celebrations, often outside on the Green. Christian Aid and the annual fete are joint affairs gathering much support from the village generally. Many people, even if not members, look to the churches for family events such as weddings and funerals. The Poors Gorse and other ancient charities have been combined to provide fuel at Christmas
